disorders.name: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD)
disorders.description: GAD involves persistent, hard-to-control worry occurring more days than not about various domains (work, health, family) and is associated with physical and cognitive symptoms.
early_signs: Frequent worry that is difficult to control

risk_factors: Family history of anxiety or related disorders
Recent or chronic stressors (work, caregiving, financial)
when_to_seek_help: Worry present most days for 6+ months
Symptoms interfere with work, school, or relationships
Panic-like symptoms or escalating physical symptoms
Using alcohol or drugs to cope
Any thoughts of self-harm or feeling unsafe
emergency_information: United States: Call or text 988 for the Suicide & Crisis Lifeline, or chat at 988lifeline.org
Text HOME to 741741 to reach a Crisis Text Line counselor
Outside the U.S.: Find international helplines at opencounseling.com/suicide-hotlines
If in immediate danger, call your local emergency number

disorders.name: Major Depressive Disorder (MDD)
disorders.description: MDD is a mood disorder featuring persistent low mood and/or loss of interest or pleasure, accompanied by changes in sleep, appetite, energy, concentration, and self-worth.
early_signs: Feelings of worthlessness or excessive guilt
Recurrent thoughts of death or self-harm

risk_factors: Family history of depression or bipolar disorder
Recent loss, trauma, or major life changes
when_to_seek_help: Symptoms present most days for 2+ weeks
Difficulty functioning at work, school, or home
Inability to care for yourself or dependents
emergency_information: United States: Call or text 988 for the Suicide & Crisis Lifeline, or chat at 988lifeline.org
Text HOME to 741741 to reach a Crisis Text Line counselor
Outside the U.S.: Find international helplines at opencounseling.com/suicide-hotlines
If in immediate danger, call your local emergency number
